climbs.name: Willit Hold?
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett, Dave Haber, and Carl Branyan, December 1990.

content.description:
Begin 30 right of

Will It or Won't It

and climb a slab with potholes, then up past several horizontal breaks to a bulge. Reach up to a thin crack/seam and follow it as it slants up and left to the

Will It or Won't It

2-bolt anchor.
content.protection: Some tiny CDs (#00,0,1 Metolius) are useful.

content.description:
Begin just left of

Will It or Won't It

and climb a slabby ramp up to a vertical crack that leads to the 2-bolt anchor for

Will It or Won't It

.

climbs.name: Will It or Won't It
climbs.fa: (TR)  Bob Gaines and Patty Kline, FA:  (Lead w/bolts) Andy Gorrill, Aubrey Adams, T.G., Ethan Micele, Evan Micele, Alex Barker, Taylor Barker, S

content.description: The route is fun and safe and cool, and has a very short approach.  What's not to like about it....
content.protection: Six bolts and one fixed pin to a bolted anchor.  Quick draws only
content.location: Located on the east face (right side) of Willit Pillar.

content.description: This is the crack system to the right of "Call of the West". If I remember well, it's tricky getting started. You might want a spot. The upper crack is the crux. I don't think it's more than 5.8. Pro is good; be aggressive.

Pull up into the thin crack that diagonals up and right across the face, just right of the start of Unknown Highway. Follow the thin crack onto the sloping shelf. Continue moving right (past the bullet scarred/pockmarked rock) and up the flakey black crack to join Hollywood & Vaino at the dark black alcove. Belay in the alcove, to avoid rope drag. Continue up Hollywood & Vaino to where it meets Call of the West. Climb up a few feet on these routes to a horizontal on the right. Follow the horizontal crack right, above the overhang, for 40ft., passing the South Face Route midway on the traverse, to a wide right leaning crack. Climb the right leaning crack to the right shoulder of Willit Pillar.
content.protection: Small cams to 3". Small cams for the initial thin crack. Rack of small cams and nuts to 3". One bolt and gear for the anchor.
content.location: Diagonals up and across the South Face of Willit Pillar from Unknown Highway, across Hollywood & Vaino and the South Face Route to the right (east) shoulder of Willit Pillar.

climbs.name: Hollywood and Vaino
climbs.fa: FA: Unknown. FFA: Vaino Kodas, Herb Laegar & Mike Jaffe, 11/80

content.description:
Face climb past two bolts into a short section of crack then move back left and climb the exposed upper headwall past three more bolts to anchors.

80 foot rap off the backside from bolts on top.
content.protection:
5 bolts, gear to 2.5 inches, bolted anchor/rap

All the old bolts have been replaced and are in good condition.
content.location:
This is the face just left of

Call of the West

, the prominent crack splitting the south face; there is a chiseled "X" at the start.

X marks the start. Photo by Blitzo.

content.description:
This climb isn't really on Willit Pillar but instead on a small rock directly behind (north of) it.

A one move wonder with a high-step past the first bolt being the action. Not a bomb perhaps but just another grainy route of which there are many.

A reasonably fun & sunny warm up on a freezing day.

On the S. Face of the Willit Pillar there is a huge chimney system. Climbing up the face ont eh right side of this can be done to avoid the rather ill-protected and crunbling beginnign of said feature. It also avoids a rather pungent mess of wet bird crap if it's been recently raining...Climb up this and into a right-facing and right-leaning crack system onto a ledge. Belay here or continue (rope drag) up and right to a face with a few heads up moves by some to reach the summit.

5.4?  Uh... sure felt harder to me.
content.protection: Some advanced skill with pro is required, in all probablility it will seem 's' to a 5.4 leader.As well, I think the rotue is a little sandbagged, as reflected in the 5.6 grade I am giving it here.

content.description: This is a decent route. It's located in the center of the south face of the formation. The crux is the right slanting crack on the upper face. Be sure to hyperventilate before you take off up the crack.
content.protection: Standard rack. Make sure you have some medium to medium+ cams for the crux.
